Is there a faster way to delete users than thru the admin webinterface

--- AI Assistant ---

--- AI Assistant ---

Based on the knowledge base, I can see information about deleting users through the web interface, but let me check if there are any API or command-line options available for bulk operations:

--- AI Assistant ---

Perfect! Yes, there are actually faster alternatives to deleting users through the web interface:

Option 1: Using the Kerio Connect API ✨



Kerio Connect offers APIs that allow you to automate user management tasks, including bulk user deletion. You can use the Administration API to programmatically remove multiple users through scripting.

  • Administration API documentation: Administration API for Kerio Connect
  • Client API documentation: Client API for Kerio Connect
  • Developer resources: Check out the Kerio Developer Zone for client libraries and sample code


You can write a script (for example, in PHP or Python) that connects to the API and loops through a list of users to delete them in bulk. This is much faster than clicking through the web interface for each user.

For more details, see: Using Kerio Connect API

Option 2: Multi-Select in Web Interface



While not as automated as the API approach, you can select multiple users at once in the web admin interface:

  1. Log in to the Kerio Connect administration console
  2. Navigate to Accounts > Users
  3. Hold Ctrl (Windows/Linux) or Cmd (Mac) and click to select multiple users
  4. Click Remove to delete them all at once


This is faster than deleting one by one, though still manual.
Which approach sounds better for your situation? Are you looking to delete a large number of users regularly (where API scripting would be ideal), or is this a one-time cleanup where multi-select might be sufficient?

--- Customer (Kjell Skoglund) ---

--- AI Assistant ---

Perfect! That's definitely the quickest manual approach. 👍

Just to make sure you have all the steps clear:

Deleting Multiple Users in the Web Interface:



  1. Log in to the Kerio Connect administration console
  2. Navigate to Accounts > Users
  3. Select your domain from the dropdown (if you have multiple domains)
  4. Hold down Ctrl (on Windows/Linux) or Cmd (on Mac) while clicking each user you want to delete
  5. Once you've selected all the users, click the Remove button
  6. You'll get a confirmation window with options for what to do with the user's data


Important note: When you delete users, you'll be prompted to choose what happens to their messages and data, so just make sure you select the appropriate option based on your needs.
Is there anything else you'd like help with regarding user management in Kerio Connect, or does this cover what you needed? 😊
